comments:
Error: Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match outer scope rule: P/<myCPPPj> 
if 'Save As' a C++ file to a different C++ project. The file will not be saved 
to the new project.
Expected: no errors, C++ file saved to the new project.
Tested on W2K SP3 with CDT2.0:
Eclipse Platform
Version: 3.0.0
Build id: 200403261517

Steps.
1. Create a C++ Project Pj1 (Standard or Managed Make C++ Project) and add a 
C++ class  C1 using the Class wizard - default values
2. Create another C++ Project  Pj2 (Standard or Managed Make C++ Project)
3. Open C1.h file and perform a File->Save As-> and try to save the C1.h into 
the Pj2.

Actual: Error: Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match outer scope rule: 
P/<myCPPPj> if 'Save As' a C++ file to a different C++ project. The file will 
not be saved to the new project.
(see below the error log)

Expected: no errors, C++ file saved to the new project.
I will raise a defect in bugzilla

See PR 59081.  The problem is deep in the TextEditor DocumentProvider
Since CEditor extends TextEditor of Eclipse we carry over the same
problem.  Lets figure out a workaround and also make a PR for Eclipse
UI

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 59081 ***

Please rename this defect to a summary of the user actions:
eg: "File > Save As fails to save CDT files in different project"

This problem does not occur with basic or Java files/projects.
In addition to C/C++ files, this problem also occurs with Makefiles.

Alain, I don't understand how this is not a CDT bug.
CDT does appear (once) in the stack trace:
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.editor.CDocumentProvider.doSaveDocument
(Unknown Source)

This looks to be different steps, different symptoms from bug 59081.
Please consider un-duplicating.

> This problem does not occur with basic or Java files/projects.
> In addition to C/C++ files, this problem also occurs with Makefiles.

That is correct, CEditor and Makefiles have the same root ...
they extend TextEditor so they will have the same problem

The Java editor does not extend the TextEditor so no you will
not have this problem.

> Alain, I don't understand how this is not a CDT bug.
> CDT does appear (once) in the stack trace:
> 	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.ui.editor.CDocumentProvider.doSaveDocument
> (Unknown Source)

Same problem different symptom.  It was fix in the head

> This looks to be different steps, different symptoms from bug 59081.
> Please consider un-duplicating.

Ok
Fix in the head, let me know if any problems

> Please rename this defect to a summary of the user actions:
> eg: "File > Save As fails to save CDT files in different project"

Sure, done.

FYI...
Retested on CDT 2.0.0.200404280300 (on Eclipse I20040413)

Fix looks verified for .cpp and .h files,
but not for Makefiles.
See stack trace below:

I've re-opened the bug since this does not work for makefiles (as per Brent's 
comments. 
He retested on CDT 2.0.0.200404280300 (on Eclipse I20040413)

Problem is resolved for .cpp and .h files, but not for Makefiles.

> I've re-opened the bug since this does not work for makefiles (as per Brent's 
> comments. 
> He retested on CDT 2.0.0.200404280300 (on Eclipse I20040413)

> Problem is resolved for .cpp and .h files, but not for Makefiles.

Allright then lets change the subject.  The MakefileDocumentProvider
needs to get in synch with Eclipse-3.0 like we did for the
CEditor ...  long work sigh..
PR was not targeted to any particular release. Changing target milestone to 2.1

I just tried the scenarios with CDT 2.0 GA 200406301134 (with Eclipse 3.0 GA 
200406251208) and the error is not reproducible anymore (no errors 
saving .h, .cpp, makefiles from a C++ project to a different one)

This defect can be closed - OK now :)
